input_text:
Job Title: ERP Analyst I

Location: Boca Raton, FL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:
Are You Looking For

 Work/Life Balance? A company where you will make a difference? A unique remote work policy? Tuition reimbursement? Fitness Reimbursement? 401K program with company match? Ownership of a well performing stock? 19 days of Paid Time Off (PTO)? Commuter Reimbursement? Cellular Phone discounts? Vehicle Discounts?

SBA is one of the top 20 Real Estate Investment Trusts (REITs) based on market capitalization. Since 1989 SBA Communications has been a leading independent owner and operator of wireless communications infrastructure. Currently in 16 countries and growing, we are seeking career

minded individuals who want to feel valued and work in a fast-paced company. You can search our openings, review our benefits, and learn more about SBA Communications by clicking on the link. https://www.sbasite.com

Your Next Career Opportunity – ERP Analyst I

This position is responsible for supporting the ERP Systems Support Teams corporate enterprise resource planning systems. Assist internal customers in using systems efficiently and effectively in fulfilling business objectives.

What You Will Do – Primary Responsibilities

Provide enterprise wide support for one or more ERP applications: Dynamics GP, CRM, Perceptive, SharePoint, Worldox, and/or all custom applications developed in-house.Provide timely technical support to users of applications. Advise, support and provide guidance in the use of ERP applications.Assist with monthly, quarterly, and yearly system process, including, but not limited to New Company Setup, WIP Closing, Job Cost Closing, Year End Closing, and 1099’s.Support new software enhancements, system processes and/or 3rd party products following implementation.Consult on improvement of business process and internal department process.Provide excellent customer service through end user support for SOX compliance.Perform unit testing, as well as coordinate and ensure all formal end-user User Acceptance Testing (UAT) is completed on time.Accountable for enforcement of IT department standards, including but not limited to, proper documentation and approval processes.Document reported incidents and resolutions in department’s incident tracking system, including tracking follow up of incidents as needed.Other projects and duties as assigned.

What You’ll Need – Qualifications & Requirements

Associate's Degree Bachelor's degree preferred;and 0-2 years experience in a Customer Support role.Citrix experience preferred.Microsoft SQL Server Management Studio experience preferred.Demonstrated knowledge and advanced proficiency working with Microsoft Office Suite software including Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel, Microsoft PowerPoint and Microsoft Outlook.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level

output_json.title: ERP Analyst I
optional_skills: Microsoft SQL Server Management Studio experience
Demonstrated knowledge and advanced proficiency working with Microsoft Office Suite software including Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel, Microsoft PowerPoint and Microsoft Outlook.
job_responsibilities: Provide enterprise wide support for one or more ERP applications.
Assist internal customers in using systems efficiently and effectively in fulfilling business objectives.
Provide timely technical support to users of applications.
Advise, support and provide guidance in the use of ERP applications.
Assist with monthly, quarterly, and yearly system process.
Support new software enhancements, system processes and/or 3rd party products following implementation.
Consult on improvement of business process and internal department process.
Perform unit testing, as well as coordinate and ensure all formal end-user User Acceptance Testing (UAT) is completed on time.
Accountable for enforcement of IT department standards.
Document reported incidents and resolutions in department’s incident tracking system.
Other projects and duties as assigned.
benefits: A company where you will make a difference
Ownership of a well performing stock

Since 1989 SBA Communications has been a leading independent owner and operator of wireless communications infrastructure. Currently in 16 countries and growing, we are seeking career-minded individuals who want to feel valued and work in a fast-paced company.
